text: First Last. Author, maintainer.

text: Last F (2026). Omics2Surv: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/FraCalanca/Omics2Surv.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Omics2Surv: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {First Last},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/FraCalanca/Omics2Surv}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Omics2Surv R package survival analysis multi-omics data.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Omics2Surv designed : Handle heterogeneous multi-omics datasets Support multiple integration strategies: - None (single-omics modeling) - Early integration - Late integration - Joint / cooperative models Store data standardized MultiAssayExperiment objects Enable fair model comparison using concordance index (C-index)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Single-omics, early late integration models: Cox LASSO Cox Elastic Net Cox Adaptive LASSO Penalized AFT models Joint integration models: CoopCox (Cooperative Cox regression) AFTCoop (Cooperative AFT regression) blockForest (Random Forest) flexynesis (Python-based deep learning survival framework)

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install Omics2Surv GitHub:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("FraCalanca/Omics2Surv")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: work supported PRIN 2022 PNRR P2022BLN38 project,Â Computational approaches integration multi-omics dataÂ funded European Union - Next Generation EU, CUPÂ B53D23027810001.

what: Train and Test Joint Multi-Omics Models â€” J_models
title: Train and Test Joint Multi-Omics Models â€” J_models
text: Applies joint (integrative) multi-omics survival analysis approaches. Trains selected joint model training data, evaluates test data, stores results MultiAssayExperiment metadata downstream analysis.

title: Train and Test Joint Multi-Omics Models â€” J_models
code: J_models(   mae,   split,   joint_method = c("CoopCox", "AFTCoop", "blockForest", "flexynesis"),   omics_list,   seed = 123,   ... )

title: Train and Test Joint Multi-Omics Models â€” J_models
text: mae MultiAssayExperiment object containing multi-omics data clinical information. Results stored metadata(mae)$analysis$cooperative. split list object returned data splitting function, containing: X_list: List omics matrices (samples rows, features columns) train_survival: Data frame training survival outcomes (columns: overall_survival, status) test_survival: Data frame test survival outcomes Row names survival data frames used identify train/test samples. joint_method Character string specifying joint modeling method use. Must one : "CoopCox": Cooperative Cox regression (supports 2-3 omics layers) "AFTCoop": Cooperative Accelerated Failure Time model (requires exactly 2 omics layers) "blockForest": Block random forest (supports number omics layers) "flexynesis": Flexible multi-omics integration via neural networks omics_list list SummarizedExperiment objects omics data. Required specifically "flexynesis" method; may NULL methods. seed Integer seed reproducibility. Default 123. Passed training functions ensure consistent results. ... Additional arguments passed specific training function. vary method: CoopCox: lambdaVector, folds, alpha, maxit AFTCoop: model, rho_values, ncore_max_rho, ncore_max_cv blockForest: prefixes, threads, always.split.variables, n_top_genes flexynesis: method-specific parameters

title: Train and Test Joint Multi-Omics Models â€” J_models
text: input MultiAssayExperiment object updated metadata. Training test results stored : metadata(mae)$analysis$cooperative[[joint_method]] contains: train: List training results including model object, predictions, C-index, selected features test: List test results including predictions C-index exact structure train/test results depends specific method used.

title: Train and Test Joint Multi-Omics Models â€” J_models
text: function performs unified workflow joint multi-omics modeling: Extracts training test sample identifiers split object Subsets omics layer training test sets Trains selected joint model training data Evaluates model held-test data Stores training test results MAE metadata joint method specific requirements: CoopCox Handles 2-3 omics layers; performs cooperative regularization cross-validation lambda selection AFTCoop Requires exactly 2 omics layers; models survival time directly using accelerated failure time framework cooperative penalties blockForest Accepts number omics layers; organizes features blocks structured random forest modeling flexynesis Flexible neural network-based integration; requires omics_list parameter

title: Train and Test Joint Multi-Omics Models â€” J_models
text: AFTCoop: stop error length(X_train_list) != 2 flexynesis: Requires omics_list parameter specified methods require consistent sample identifiers across omics layers

title: Train and Test Joint Multi-Omics Models â€” J_models
text: Results stored hierarchically MAE metadata:
code: metadata(mae)   â””â”€ analysis      â””â”€ cooperative         â””â”€ [joint_method]            â”œâ”€ train (training results)            â””â”€ test (test results)

title: Late Integration of Penalized Regression Models Across Multiple Omics Layers â€” L_pen_regression_models
code: L_pen_regression_models(   mae,   omic_list,   surv_list,   method = "RRA",   model = c("cox_lasso", "cox_adaptive_lasso", "cox_elastic_net", "aft_pen"),   train_fraction = 0.7,   seed = 123 )

title: Late Integration of Penalized Regression Models Across Multiple Omics Layers â€” L_pen_regression_models
text: mae MultiAssayExperiment object containing multiple omics datasets clinical information. Results stored metadata(mae)$analysis$late_integration. omic_list list omics layer names (SummarizedExperiment objects) corresponding assays MAE. modeled independently. Common samples across layers automatically identified used. surv_list specification extracting survival data MAE, typically containing column names time event variables. Passed prepare_surv_data. method Character string specifying late integration method combining predictions across omics layers. Must one : "average": Simple weighted average risk scores "RRA": Robust Rank Aggregation, combines rankings rather raw scores (default) Default "average". model Character string specifying penalized regression model fit omics layer. Must one : "cox_lasso": Cox regression Lasso penalty "cox_adaptive_lasso": Cox regression adaptive Lasso penalty "cox_elastic_net": Cox regression elastic net penalty "aft_pen": Accelerated Failure Time model elastic net grouped lasso penalties Default "cox_lasso". train_fraction Numeric value 0 1 specifying proportion samples use training. remainder used testing. Default 0.7 (70\ seedInteger seed reproducibility train/test split. Default 123. seed ensures identical splits across omics layers. input MultiAssayExperiment object updated metadata. Results stored metadata(mae)$analysis$late_integration[[model]] containing: train: Late integration results training data, including: Ensemble predictions (combined risk scores) Ensemble C-index Individual omics-specific predictions C-indices Integration method used test: Late integration results test data structure Identifies common samples across omics layers Creates single reference train/test split based first omics layer Applies split omics layers (ensures consistency) Trains specified penalized model independently omics layer Combines predictions layers using specified integration method Evaluates ensemble performance training test sets Stores individual ensemble results MAE metadata average Combines risk scores averaging. Can simple mean weighted based layer-specific performance. Assumes risk scores comparable scales. RRA Robust Rank Aggregation converts predictions ranks within layer, combines ranks. robust outliers scale differences. Useful absolute risk scores vary widely across layers. Result OrganizationResults stored hierarchically: S_or_E_pen_regression_models single omics penalized regression late_integration integration function split_train_test data splitting prepare_design_matrix omics data preparation
code: metadata(mae)   â””â”€ analysis      â”œâ”€ [model]                     # Individual omics results      â”‚  â”œâ”€ [omic_1]      â”‚  â”‚  â”œâ”€ train      â”‚  â”‚  â””â”€ test      â”‚  â””â”€ [omic_2]      â”‚     â”œâ”€ train      â”‚     â””â”€ test      â””â”€ late_integration            # Ensemble results         â””â”€ [model]            â”œâ”€ train (ensemble)            â””â”€ test (ensemble)

title: LinkedOmics-like data format â€” LinkedOmicsLikeData
text: package accepts either data retrieved LinkedOmics user-provided data, long input follows structure LinkedOmics data import.

title: LinkedOmics-like data format â€” LinkedOmicsLikeData
text: expected input feature--sample matrix. General requirements: Input must data.frame matrix. Rows represent features (genes, proteins, CpGs, clinical variables). Columns represent samples. Feature identifiers must stored row names. Sample identifiers must stored column names. Omics data: row corresponds molecular feature. Values numeric. Clinical data: Rows correspond clinical variables. following rows required: overall_survival status

what: Single or Early Integration Penalized Regression Models â€” S_or_E_pen_regression_models
title: Single or Early Integration Penalized Regression Models â€” S_or_E_pen_regression_models
text: Trains tests penalized regression survival models single omics layer early-integrated (concatenated) features, storing results MultiAssayExperiment metadata.

title: Single or Early Integration Penalized Regression Models â€” S_or_E_pen_regression_models
code: S_or_E_pen_regression_models(   mae,   assay_name,   split,   method = c("cox_lasso", "cox_adaptive_lasso", "cox_elastic_net", "aft_pen"),   seed = 123,   ... )

title: Single or Early Integration Penalized Regression Models â€” S_or_E_pen_regression_models
text: mae MultiAssayExperiment object. assay_name Character string specifying assay name model (e.g., single omics layer "early_integrated"). split list containing: train_omic: Training design matrix (samples Ã— features) test_omic: Test design matrix train_survival: Training survival data frame overall_survival status test_survival: Test survival data frame method Character string specifying penalized model: "cox_lasso", "cox_adaptive_lasso", "cox_elastic_net", "aft_pen". seed Integer seed reproducibility. Default 123. ... Additional arguments passed training function (e.g., alpha, nfolds).

title: Single or Early Integration Penalized Regression Models â€” S_or_E_pen_regression_models
text: input MultiAssayExperiment object results stored metadata(mae)$analysis[[method]][[assay_name]] containing: train: Training results (model, predictions, C-index, selected features) test: Test results (predictions, C-index)

what: Build a MultiAssayExperiment Object from Omics Data â€” build_MAE
title: Build a MultiAssayExperiment Object from Omics Data â€” build_MAE
text: Constructs MultiAssayExperiment (MAE) container integrates multiple omics datasets associated clinical/phenotypic data. unified data structure facilitates multi-omics analysis ensures coordinated sample management across different data types.

title: Build a MultiAssayExperiment Object from Omics Data â€” build_MAE
code: build_MAE(omics_list, clinical_data)

title: Build a MultiAssayExperiment Object from Omics Data â€” build_MAE
text: omics_list named list SummarizedExperiment objects, element represents different omics dataset (e.g., gene expression, methylation, proteomics). elements must valid SummarizedExperiment objects. List names used experiment identifiers resulting MAE. clinical_data matrix data frame clinical/phenotypic data : Rows represent different clinical variables (features) Columns represent samples Column names match sample identifiers across omics datasets transposed internally rows represent samples final MAE.

title: Build a MultiAssayExperiment Object from Omics Data â€” build_MAE
text: MultiAssayExperiment object containing: experiments: omics datasets omics_list colData: Transposed type-converted clinical data DataFrame, rows represent samples columns represent clinical variables Coordinated sample mapping across experiments

title: Build a MultiAssayExperiment Object from Omics Data â€” build_MAE
text: function performs following operations: Validates elements omics_list SummarizedExperiment objects Transposes clinical_data samples rows (standard MAE format) Preserves sample identifiers rownames transposition Automatically converts column types using type.convert (e.g., strings factors, numeric strings numbers) .= FALSE Constructs MultiAssayExperiment proper S4 DataFrame structure Prints confirmation message number omics datasets included resulting MAE object enables: Unified access multiple omics layers Automatic subsetting across experiments Integration Bioconductor workflows Sample-level metadata management

title: Build a MultiAssayExperiment Object from Omics Data â€” build_MAE
text: SummarizedExperiment omics_list sample identifiers column names (colData) Clinical data column names correspond sample identifiers Sample matching across experiments handled automatically MAE

what: Dichotomize Continuous Risk Scores into High and Low Risk Groups â€” dichotomize_risk_groups
title: Dichotomize Continuous Risk Scores into High and Low Risk Groups â€” dichotomize_risk_groups
text: Converts continuous risk predictions binary risk groups (High/Low) based cutoff threshold. cutoff can determined training data using median, custom value, applied test data risk stratification.

title: Dichotomize Continuous Risk Scores into High and Low Risk Groups â€” dichotomize_risk_groups
code: dichotomize_risk_groups(   pred_train,   pred_test,   method = "median",   custom_cutoff = NULL )

title: Dichotomize Continuous Risk Scores into High and Low Risk Groups â€” dichotomize_risk_groups
text: pred_train Numeric vector risk predictions training set. Used determine cutoff threshold. NA values removed calculating median cutoffs. pred_test Numeric vector risk predictions test set (dataset stratified). predictions classified High Low risk based cutoff derived pred_train. method Character string specifying method determine cutoff threshold. Options : "median": Use median training predictions "custom": Use user-specified cutoff value (requires custom_cutoff) Default "median". custom_cutoff Numeric value specifying custom cutoff threshold. used method = "custom". Must provided custom method selected. Default NULL.

title: Dichotomize Continuous Risk Scores into High and Low Risk Groups â€” dichotomize_risk_groups
text: list containing: groups Factor vector two levels ("Low", "High") indicating risk group assignment sample pred_test. Samples predictions cutoff classified "High" risk; "Low" risk. cutoff Numeric value threshold used dichotomization. allows users see exact cutoff applied use consistently across multiple datasets.

title: Dichotomize Continuous Risk Scores into High and Low Risk Groups â€” dichotomize_risk_groups
text: function commonly used survival analysis : Stratify patients risk groups Kaplan-Meier analysis Create interpretable clinical risk categories continuous scores Enable comparison survival curves high low risk groups Facilitate risk-based treatment decision making Classification logic: pred_test > cutoff â†’ "High" risk pred_test <= cutoff â†’ "Low" risk

title: Dichotomize Continuous Risk Scores into High and Low Risk Groups â€” dichotomize_risk_groups
text: Median Robust outliers; splits training samples equal-sized groups. Custom Allows domain-specific thresholds based clinical relevance, prior studies, optimization criteria.

what: Early Integration of Multiple Omics Layers â€” early_integration
title: Early Integration of Multiple Omics Layers â€” early_integration
text: Performs early integration (early fusion) multiple omics datasets concatenating feature matrices single unified matrix. omics layers combined modeling, creating comprehensive feature space includes measured molecular variables.

title: Early Integration of Multiple Omics Layers â€” early_integration
code: early_integration(mae, omics_names, new_layer_name = "early_integrated")

title: Early Integration of Multiple Omics Layers â€” early_integration
text: mae MultiAssayExperiment object containing multiple omics experiments. omics_names Character vector specifying names omics experiments integrate. Must match experiment names names(mae). Typically includes 2-3 layers c("transcriptomics", "proteomics", "methylation"). new_layer_name Character string specifying name new integrated assay added MAE. Default "early_integrated".

title: Early Integration of Multiple Omics Layers â€” early_integration
text: MultiAssayExperiment object containing: original omics experiments input MAE (subset common samples) new experiment named new_layer_name containing integrated feature matrix integrated experiment SummarizedExperiment : Rows: features omics layers (concatenated) Columns: Samples common across specified omics layers Row names: Prefixed omics layer name (e.g., "transcriptomics_GENE1")

title: Early Integration of Multiple Omics Layers â€” early_integration
text: early integration workflow consists : Sample alignment: Identifies retains samples present specified omics layers using intersectColumns() Feature concatenation: Extracts feature matrix omics layer Prefixes row names omics layer identifier ensure uniqueness Concatenates matrices rows (vertical stacking) SummarizedExperiment creation: Packages combined matrix SummarizedExperiment object MAE integration: Adds integrated layer original MAE preserving original experiments

what: Filter Omics Data to Retain Only Common Samples Across All Layers â€” filter_common_patients
title: Filter Omics Data to Retain Only Common Samples Across All Layers â€” filter_common_patients
text: Identifies retains samples (patients) present across omics datasets. ensures complete multi-omics profiles downstream integrative analysis removing samples missing data omics layer.

title: Filter Omics Data to Retain Only Common Samples Across All Layers â€” filter_common_patients
code: filter_common_patients(omics_list)

title: Filter Omics Data to Retain Only Common Samples Across All Layers â€” filter_common_patients
text: omics_list list omics data objects (typically SummarizedExperiment objects matrices) : element represents different omics layer (e.g., transcriptomics, proteomics, methylation) Samples represented columns Column names contain sample identifiers consistent across layers

title: Filter Omics Data to Retain Only Common Samples Across All Layers â€” filter_common_patients
text: list length structure omics_list, element subset include common samples. order samples (columns) consistent across returned omics layers. Sample order follows intersection order determined Reduce(intersect, ...).

title: Filter Omics Data to Retain Only Common Samples Across All Layers â€” filter_common_patients
text: function performs following operations: Extracts column names (sample IDs) omics layer Identifies samples present layers using set intersection Subsets omics object retain common samples Preserves original data structure class omics layer filtering step essential multi-omics integration : Many integration methods require complete data across modalities prevents errors sample mismatches analysis ensures fair comparison across omics layers identifies cohort comprehensive multi-omics profiling function stop error samples common across layers, may indicate: Inconsistent sample naming conventions Non-overlapping patient cohorts

what: Late Integration of Multi-Omics Survival Predictions â€” late_integration
title: Late Integration of Multi-Omics Survival Predictions â€” late_integration
text: Combines risk predictions multiple independently-trained omics models single consensus prediction. Supports averaging normalized ranks Robust Rank Aggregation (RRA) create ensemble prediction leverages information omics layers.

title: Late Integration of Multi-Omics Survival Predictions â€” late_integration
code: late_integration(   res_list,   y,   model = c("cox_lasso", "cox_adaptive_lasso", "cox_elastic_net", "aft_pen"),   method = c("average", "RRA") )

title: Late Integration of Multi-Omics Survival Predictions â€” late_integration
text: res_list named list element contains results single omics layer model. element must include: pred: Numeric vector risk predictions samples List names typically represent omics layers (e.g., "transcriptomics", "proteomics"). y data frame containing survival outcomes columns: overall_survival: Numeric survival time status: Numeric event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored) Row names correspond patient/sample identifiers. model Character string specifying underlying prediction model type. Must one : "cox_lasso": Cox Lasso regression "cox_adaptive_lasso": Adaptive Cox Lasso "cox_elastic_net": Cox elastic net "aft_pen": Penalized Accelerated Failure Time model method Character string specifying integration method. Must one : "average": Average normalized ranks across omics layers "RRA": Robust Rank Aggregation using RobustRankAggreg package

title: Late Integration of Multi-Omics Survival Predictions â€” late_integration
text: list containing: pred Numeric vector consensus risk ranks patients. Lower ranks indicate lower risk (longer predicted survival). Length equals number patients. merged_risks Data frame containing: patient_id: Sample identifiers risk_omics1, risk_omics2, ...: Original risk scores omics layer norm_omics1, norm_omics2, ...: Z-score normalized risk scores rank_omics1, rank_omics2, ...: Ranks normalized scores within layer consensus_rank: Final integrated consensus rank cindex Numeric concordance index (C-index) evaluating consensus predictions observed survival outcomes.

title: Late Integration of Multi-Omics Survival Predictions â€” late_integration
text: late integration workflow consists following steps: Extract: Collect risk scores omics layer model Merge: Combine risk scores single data frame patient ID Normalize: Z-score standardize risk scores within omics layer (mean = 0, SD = 1) make comparable across layers Rank: Convert normalized scores ranks within layer using average method ties Integrate: Combine ranks across layers: average: Simple arithmetic mean ranks RRA: Statistical aggregation accounting rank distribution Evaluate: Calculate C-index consensus predictions

what: Prepare Copy Number Variation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_CNV_SE
title: Prepare Copy Number Variation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_CNV_SE
text: Processes copy number variation (CNV) data filtering constant genes, optionally performing feature selection using supervised (survival-based) unsupervised (variability-based) methods, packaging results SummarizedExperiment object downstream analysis.

title: Prepare Copy Number Variation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_CNV_SE
code: prepare_CNV_SE(   cnv_data,   clinical_data,   variability_threshold = 0.25,   method = NULL,   p_threshold = NULL,   top_n_supervised = NULL )

title: Prepare Copy Number Variation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_CNV_SE
text: cnv_data numeric matrix CNV data : Rows represent genes/genomic regions Columns represent samples Values typically represent copy number states (e.g., -2, -1, 0, 1, 2) continuous copy number estimates clinical_data matrix data frame clinical data : Columns represent samples (matching cnv_data column names) Rows represent clinical variables Must include rows named "overall_survival" "status" using supervised feature selection variability_threshold Numeric value 0 1 specifying proportion variable genes retain method = "unsupervised". example, 0.25 retains top 25\ "unsupervised". method Character string specifying feature selection method. Options : "supervised": Cox regression-based selection using survival outcomes "unsupervised": Variability-based selection (outcome information) NULL: additional filtering beyond constant gene removal (default) Default NULL. p_threshold Numeric p-value threshold supervised feature selection. genes Cox regression p-values <= p_threshold retained. Required method = "supervised". Ignored otherwise. Default NULL. top_n_supervised Integer specifying number top genes select fewer 100 genes pass p-value threshold supervised selection. Acts fallback ensure minimum number features. Default NULL.

title: Prepare Copy Number Variation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_CNV_SE
text: SummarizedExperiment object containing: assays: List one element named "counts" containing filtered CNV matrix metadata: List preprocessing information: omics: "CNV" method: feature selection method used

title: Prepare Copy Number Variation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_CNV_SE
text: function performs following processing steps: Sample alignment: Identifies retains samples present CNV clinical data Constant gene removal: Removes genes variation across samples (values identical) Feature selection (optional): Supervised: Fits univariate Cox regression gene, retains genes p-value <= p_threshold. Uses parallel processing speed. Falls back top N genes < 100 pass threshold. Unsupervised: Calculates variability sum absolute CNV values, retains top variability_threshold proportion genes SummarizedExperiment creation: Packages filtered data metadata

what: Prepare custom data in LinkedOmics-like format â€” prepare_custom_data
title: Prepare custom data in LinkedOmics-like format â€” prepare_custom_data
text: Prepare custom data LinkedOmics-like format

title: Prepare custom data in LinkedOmics-like format â€” prepare_custom_data
code: prepare_custom_data(data, data_type = c("Omics", "Clinical"))

title: Prepare custom data in LinkedOmics-like format â€” prepare_custom_data
text: data data.frame matrix LinkedOmics-like format data_type Character string specifying data type. Supported values "Omics" "Clinical".

title: Prepare custom data in LinkedOmics-like format â€” prepare_custom_data
text: cleaned data.frame ready downstream analyses.

what: Prepare Design Matrix from MultiAssayExperiment for Modeling â€” prepare_design_matrix
title: Prepare Design Matrix from MultiAssayExperiment for Modeling â€” prepare_design_matrix
text: Extracts omics data MultiAssayExperiment object optionally combines clinical variables create design matrix suitable survival modeling. Handles sample ordering, NA removal, factor variable conversion.

title: Prepare Design Matrix from MultiAssayExperiment for Modeling â€” prepare_design_matrix
code: prepare_design_matrix(mae, assay_name, clinical_list = NULL, remove_na = TRUE)

title: Prepare Design Matrix from MultiAssayExperiment for Modeling â€” prepare_design_matrix
text: mae MultiAssayExperiment object containing omics experiments clinical data colData. assay_name Character string specifying name assay (omics layer) extract MAE. Must match experiment name names(mae). clinical_list Character vector clinical variable names include design matrix. Variables extracted colData(mae). NULL, omics features included. Default NULL. remove_na Logical indicating whether remove samples (rows) missing values. TRUE, samples NA variable excluded. FALSE, NAs retained. Default TRUE.

title: Prepare Design Matrix from MultiAssayExperiment for Modeling â€” prepare_design_matrix
text: numeric matrix : Rows represent samples (patients) Columns represent features: Clinical variables (clinical_list specified), followed Omics features (genes, proteins, metabolites, etc.) Row names sample identifiers Column names feature names values numeric (factors converted numeric codes)

title: Prepare Design Matrix from MultiAssayExperiment for Modeling â€” prepare_design_matrix
text: function performs following operations: Extract omics data: Retrieves "counts" assay specified experiment MAE Determine sample order: Uses column names omics data reference sample ordering Extract clinical data: Retrieves clinical variables MAE colData, ordered match omics samples Combine data (clinical_list specified): Subsets clinical variables requested list Converts factors numeric codes Binds clinical variables (columns) transposed omics data Handle missing data (remove_na = TRUE): Identifies samples NA values Removes samples design matrix

what: Prepare mRNA Expression Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_mRNA_SE
title: Prepare mRNA Expression Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_mRNA_SE
text: Processes mRNA expression data aligning samples clinical data, removing genes missing values low expression, optionally performing supervised unsupervised feature selection.

title: Prepare mRNA Expression Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_mRNA_SE
code: prepare_mRNA_SE(   RNA_data,   clinical_data,   q_threshold = 0.25,   method = NULL,   p_threshold = 0.1,   hvg_threshold = 25 )

title: Prepare mRNA Expression Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_mRNA_SE
text: RNA_data Numeric matrix mRNA expression data (genes rows, samples columns). clinical_data Matrix data frame clinical data (variables rows, samples columns). Must include "overall_survival" "status" rows supervised selection. q_threshold Numeric quantile threshold (0-1) low expression filtering. Genes expression quantile equal 0 removed. Default 0.25. method Character string feature selection: "supervised" (Cox regression-based), "unsupervised" (high variable genes), NULL (selection). Default NULL. p_threshold Numeric p-value threshold supervised selection. Default 0.1. hvg_threshold Numeric percentile (0-100) highly variable gene selection unsupervised method. Default 25 (top 25% variable genes).

title: Prepare mRNA Expression Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_mRNA_SE
text: SummarizedExperiment object : assays$counts: Filtered mRNA expression matrix metadata$preprocessing: List omics = "mRNA" method used

what: Prepare Methylation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_methyl_SE
title: Prepare Methylation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_methyl_SE
text: Processes methylation data aligning samples clinical data, removing incomplete cases, optionally performing supervised unsupervised feature selection.

title: Prepare Methylation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_methyl_SE
code: prepare_methyl_SE(   methyl_data,   clinical_data,   system_type = "unix",   method = NULL,   p_threshold = 0.1,   iqr_threshold = 0.25 )

title: Prepare Methylation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_methyl_SE
text: methyl_data Numeric matrix methylation data (genes/CpG sites rows, samples columns). clinical_data Matrix data frame clinical data (variables rows, samples columns). Must include "overall_survival" "status" rows supervised selection. system_type Character string specifying OS type ("unix" ). Currently unused; parallel backend auto-detected platform. method Character string feature selection: "supervised" (Cox regression-based), "unsupervised" (IQR-based), NULL (selection). Default NULL. p_threshold Numeric p-value threshold supervised selection. Default 0.1. iqr_threshold Numeric proportion (0-1) top IQR genes retain unsupervised selection. Default 0.25.

title: Prepare Methylation Data as SummarizedExperiment â€” prepare_methyl_SE
text: SummarizedExperiment object : assays$counts: Filtered methylation matrix metadata$preprocessing: List omics = "methylation" method used

what: Prepare Survival Data from MultiAssayExperiment â€” prepare_surv_data
title: Prepare Survival Data from MultiAssayExperiment â€” prepare_surv_data
text: Extracts survival outcome variables MultiAssayExperiment's colData optionally reorders samples match specified order.

title: Prepare Survival Data from MultiAssayExperiment â€” prepare_surv_data
code: prepare_surv_data(mae, surv_list, sample_order = NULL)

title: Prepare Survival Data from MultiAssayExperiment â€” prepare_surv_data
text: mae MultiAssayExperiment object containing clinical data colData. surv_list Character vector column names colData(mae) representing survival variables (e.g., c("overall_survival", "status")). sample_order Optional character vector sample identifiers specifying desired row order. NULL, original order preserved. Default NULL.

title: Prepare Survival Data from MultiAssayExperiment â€” prepare_surv_data
text: data frame containing: Columns: Survival variables specified surv_list Rows: Samples, ordered according sample_order provided Row names: Sample identifiers

what: Retrieve LinkedOmics Data from TCGA â€” retrieve_linkedomics_data
title: Retrieve LinkedOmics Data from TCGA â€” retrieve_linkedomics_data
text: Downloads omics clinical data specific cancer type LinkedOmics via TCGAbiolinks, performs quality checks, formats data analysis.

title: Retrieve LinkedOmics Data from TCGA â€” retrieve_linkedomics_data
code: retrieve_linkedomics_data(cancer_type, data_type)

title: Retrieve LinkedOmics Data from TCGA â€” retrieve_linkedomics_data
text: cancer_type Character string specifying TCGA cancer type abbreviation (e.g., "BRCA", "LUAD", "COAD"). data_type Character string specifying data type retrieve (e.g., "Clinical", "mRNA", "Protein", "miRNA"). See TCGAbiolinks documentation available types.

title: Retrieve LinkedOmics Data from TCGA â€” retrieve_linkedomics_data
text: data frame : Rows: Features (genes, proteins, clinical variables, etc.) attrib_name column Columns: Samples (TCGA patient identifiers) clinical data: Samples NA "overall_survival" "status" removed

what: Run Joint Multi-Omics Survival Models â€” run_joint_models
title: Run Joint Multi-Omics Survival Models â€” run_joint_models
text: Performs end--end joint modeling workflow: builds MultiAssayExperiment omics data, prepares design matrices, splits data train/test sets, fits specified joint integration model.

title: Run Joint Multi-Omics Survival Models â€” run_joint_models
code: run_joint_models(   omics_list,   clinical_data,   surv_list,   joint_method = c("CoopCox", "AFTCoop", "blockForest", "flexynesis"),   train_fraction = 0.7,   seed = 123,   ... )

title: Run Joint Multi-Omics Survival Models â€” run_joint_models
text: omics_list Named list SummarizedExperiment objects, representing omics layer (e.g., transcriptomics, proteomics). clinical_data Matrix data frame clinical data (variables rows, samples columns). surv_list Character vector survival variable names clinical data (e.g., c("overall_survival", "status")). joint_method Character string specifying joint model: "CoopCox" (2-3 omics), "AFTCoop" (exactly 2 omics), "blockForest" (number), "flexynesis". train_fraction Numeric proportion (0-1) samples training. Default 0.7. seed Integer seed reproducibility. Default 123. ... Additional arguments passed specific joint modeling function.

title: Run Joint Multi-Omics Survival Models â€” run_joint_models
text: MultiAssayExperiment object results stored metadata(mae)$analysis$cooperative[[joint_method]] containing: train: Training results (model, predictions, C-index, selected features) test: Test results (predictions, C-index)

what: Run Model Comparison Pipeline for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” run_model_comparison_pipeline
title: Run Model Comparison Pipeline for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” run_model_comparison_pipeline
text: Executes comprehensive comparison multiple survival models across different integration strategies (none, early, late, joint), returning performance metrics model.

title: Run Model Comparison Pipeline for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” run_model_comparison_pipeline
code: run_model_comparison_pipeline(   omics_list,   clinical_data,   surv_list,   integration = c("none", "early", "late", "joint"),   model_methods,   train_fraction = 0.7,   seed = 123,   late_method = c("average", "RRA"),   ... )

title: Run Model Comparison Pipeline for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” run_model_comparison_pipeline
text: omics_list Named list SummarizedExperiment objects, representing omics layer. clinical_data Matrix data frame clinical data (variables rows, samples columns). surv_list Character vector survival variable names (e.g., c("overall_survival", "status")). integration Character string specifying integration strategy: "none" (single omics), "early" (concatenated features), "late" (ensemble predictions), "joint" (cooperative modeling). model_methods Character vector model names compare. Options depend integration: "none"/"early", use penalized regression models; "late", use ; "joint", use c("CoopCox", "AFTCoop", "blockForest",   "flexynesis"). train_fraction Numeric proportion (0-1) samples training. Default 0.7. seed Integer seed reproducibility. Default 123. late_method Character string late integration: "average" "RRA". used integration = "late". Default "average". ... Additional arguments passed model-specific functions.

title: Run Model Comparison Pipeline for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” run_model_comparison_pipeline
text: list containing: comparison: Data frame columns model, train_cindex, test_cindex model tested per_model_results: Named list detailed results model, including reports metadata(mae)$analysis

what: Run Penalized Regression Models with Multi-Omics Integration â€” run_penalized_regression_models
title: Run Penalized Regression Models with Multi-Omics Integration â€” run_penalized_regression_models
text: Applies penalized regression survival models (Lasso, adaptive Lasso, elastic net, AFT) using single omics, early integration (concatenated features), late integration (ensemble predictions).

title: Run Penalized Regression Models with Multi-Omics Integration â€” run_penalized_regression_models
code: run_penalized_regression_models(   omics_list,   clinical_data,   surv_list,   integration = c("none", "early", "late"),   model_method = c("cox_lasso", "cox_adaptive_lasso", "cox_elastic_net", "aft_pen"),   train_fraction = 0.7,   seed = 123,   late_method = c("average", "RRA"),   ... )

title: Run Penalized Regression Models with Multi-Omics Integration â€” run_penalized_regression_models
text: omics_list Named list SummarizedExperiment objects, representing omics layer. clinical_data Matrix data frame clinical data (variables rows, samples columns). surv_list Character vector survival variable names (e.g., c("overall_survival", "status")). integration Character string specifying integration strategy: "none" (single omics layer), "early" (concatenate features modeling), "late" (model layer separately, ensemble). model_method Character string specifying penalized model: "cox_lasso", "cox_adaptive_lasso", "cox_elastic_net", "aft_pen". train_fraction Numeric proportion (0-1) samples training. Default 0.7. seed Integer seed reproducibility. Default 123. late_method Character string late integration: "average" "RRA". used integration = "late". Default "average". ... Additional arguments passed penalized regression functions.

title: Run Penalized Regression Models with Multi-Omics Integration â€” run_penalized_regression_models
text: MultiAssayExperiment object results stored metadata(mae)$analysis: "none" "early": Results metadata(mae)$analysis[[model_method]][[assay_name]] "late": Results metadata(mae)$analysis$late_integration[[model_method]] contains train test results predictions C-index.

what: Split Data into Training and Testing Sets â€” split_train_test
title: Split Data into Training and Testing Sets â€” split_train_test
text: Randomly partitions design matrix corresponding survival data training testing subsets based specified proportion.

title: Split Data into Training and Testing Sets â€” split_train_test
code: split_train_test(design_matrix, surv_data, seed = 4820, train_fraction = NULL)

title: Split Data into Training and Testing Sets â€” split_train_test
text: design_matrix matrix data frame predictor variables (omics data), rows represent samples. surv_data matrix data frame containing survival outcomes, row names matching design_matrix. seed integer used set random seed reproducibility. Default 4820. train_fraction numeric value 0 1 indicating proportion samples include training set.

title: Split Data into Training and Testing Sets â€” split_train_test
text: named list containing four elements: train_omic: Training subset design matrix. test_omic: Testing subset design matrix. train_survival: Training subset survival data. test_survival: Testing subset survival data.

what: Test AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_AFTCoop
title: Test AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_AFTCoop
text: Evaluates trained AFT cooperative learning model test data generating predictions calculating concordance indices rho value.

title: Test AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_AFTCoop
code: test_AFTCoop(x_test1, x_test2, y_test, training_result)

title: Test AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_AFTCoop
text: x_test1 matrix data frame first set test predictors. Must features (columns) x_training1 used training. x_test2 matrix data frame second set test predictors. Must features (columns) x_training2 used training. y_test data frame containing test survival outcomes columns: overall_survival: Numeric survival time status: Numeric event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored) training_result list object returned train_AFTCoop containing trained model coefficients parameters.

title: Test AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_AFTCoop
text: list containing: pred Named list test set predictions rho value. Higher predicted values indicate higher risk (shorter predicted survival). cindex Named list concordance indices (C-index) test data rho value. Values range 0 1, 0.5 indicates random predictions 1.0 indicates perfect concordance.

title: Test AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_AFTCoop
text: function applies coefficients learned training new test data. rho value trained model: Extracts corresponding coefficient vector Generates risk predictions using predict_aft_coop Calculates concordance index (C-index) comparing predictions actual outcomes

what: Test Block Random Forest Model â€” test_blockForest
title: Test Block Random Forest Model â€” test_blockForest
text: Evaluates trained block random forest model test data generating risk predictions calculating concordance index.

title: Test Block Random Forest Model â€” test_blockForest
code: test_blockForest(x_test, y_test, training_result, num_threads = 10)

title: Test Block Random Forest Model â€” test_blockForest
text: x_test matrix data frame test predictors. Must features (columns) x_training used training, including matching column names prefixes. y_test data frame containing test survival outcomes columns: overall_survival: Numeric survival time status: Numeric event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored) training_result list object returned train_blockForest containing trained model associated parameters. Note: function expects training_result$model_BF, train_blockForest returns training_result$model. Ensure compatibility adjust accordingly. num_threads Integer specifying number parallel threads use prediction. Default 10.

title: Test Block Random Forest Model â€” test_blockForest
text: list containing: pred Numeric vector linear predictors (risk scores) test samples, extracted final column cumulative hazard function (CHF). Higher values indicate higher risk (shorter predicted survival). cindex Numeric concordance index (C-index) test data. Values range 0 1, 0.5 indicates random predictions 1.0 indicates perfect concordance. Calculated reverse = TRUE account risk score directionality.

title: Test Block Random Forest Model â€” test_blockForest
text: function applies trained block random forest model new test data: Prepares test data format training data Generates predictions using trained model Extracts risk scores cumulative hazard function (CHF) Calculates concordance index evaluate prediction accuracy

what: Test Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_cooplearning
title: Test Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_cooplearning
text: Evaluates trained cooperative learning model test data generating risk predictions calculating concordance index.

title: Test Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_cooplearning
code: test_cooplearning(X_list_test, y_test, training_result)

title: Test Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_cooplearning
text: X_list_test named list omics data matrices data frames testing. Must contain omics layers (order matching feature names) used training. element : Samples rows matching row names across omics layers Features columns, matching training data y_test data frame containing test survival outcomes : Row names matching sample identifiers X_list_test Column overall_survival: Numeric survival time Column status: Numeric event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored) training_result list object returned train_cooplearning containing trained model coefficients.

title: Test Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_cooplearning
text: list containing: pred Numeric vector risk scores test samples. Higher values indicate higher risk (shorter predicted survival). Calculated linear combination features weighted learned coefficients. cindex Numeric concordance index (C-index) test data. Values range 0 1, 0.5 indicates random predictions 1.0 indicates perfect concordance. Calculated reverse = TRUE account risk score directionality.

title: Test Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_cooplearning
text: function applies trained cooperative learning model new test data: Validates X_list_test list Aligns test samples across omics layers using common identifiers Combines omics layers single feature matrix Ensures feature names match training model Computes risk scores weighted sum: X_test %*% coefficients Calculates C-index evaluate prediction performance C-index measures model's discriminative abilityâ€”probability , randomly selected pair patients, model correctly ranks patient experience event first.

title: Test Cooperative Learning Model â€” test_cooplearning
text: Test omics layers must match training layers number, order, features samples present test omics layers used Feature names must consistent training data

what: Evaluate Cox GLMNET Model on Test Data â€” test_cox_glmnet
title: Evaluate Cox GLMNET Model on Test Data â€” test_cox_glmnet
text: Predicts risk scores calculates Concordance Index (C-index) fitted Cox lasso model using independent test data.

title: Evaluate Cox GLMNET Model on Test Data â€” test_cox_glmnet
code: test_cox_glmnet(x_test, y_test, training_result)

title: Evaluate Cox GLMNET Model on Test Data â€” test_cox_glmnet
text: x_test matrix data frame predictor variables test set. y_test data frame matrix containing survival information. Must include columns overall_survival (time) status (event). training_result list containing trained model objects: cv_fit: fitted cv.glmnet object. selected_lambda: penalty parameter (\(\lambda\)) use prediction.

title: Evaluate Cox GLMNET Model on Test Data â€” test_cox_glmnet
text: named list containing: pred: matrix predicted risk scores (linear predictors) test set. cindex: numeric value representing Harrell's Concordance Index.

what: Train AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” train_AFTCoop
title: Train AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” train_AFTCoop
text: Trains Accelerated Failure Time (AFT) model using cooperative learning two sets predictors. function fits regularized survival model across multiple correlation (rho) values returns coefficients, predictions, performance metrics.

title: Train AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” train_AFTCoop
code: train_AFTCoop(   x_training1,   x_training2,   y_training,   model = "weibull",   rho_values = c(0.25, 0.5, 0.75),   ncore_max_rho = 10,   ncore_max_cv = 10,   seed = 123 )

title: Train AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” train_AFTCoop
text: x_training1 matrix data frame first set training predictors (e.g., first omic features). x_training2 matrix data frame second set training predictors (e.g., second omic features). y_training data frame containing survival outcomes columns: overall_survival: Numeric survival time status: Numeric event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored) model Character string specifying AFT distribution. Default "weibull". options include "lognormal" "loglogistic". rho_values Numeric vector correlation penalty parameters evaluate. Default c(0.25, 0.5, 0.75). Controls cooperation two predictor sets. ncore_max_rho Integer specifying maximum number cores use parallel processing across rho values. Default 10. ncore_max_cv Integer specifying maximum number cores use cross-validation. Default 10. seed Integer seed reproducibility. Default 123.

title: Train AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” train_AFTCoop
text: list containing: final_model_coefs Data frame coefficient estimates rho value. Rows correspond features predictor sets, columns rho values. sigma_est Numeric estimated scale parameter (sigma) AFT model. rho_values Numeric vector rho values used training (input). pred Training set predictions rho value. cindex Concordance indices (C-index) training data rho value. selected_features Named list selected (non-zero) features rho value.

title: Train AFT Cooperative Learning Model â€” train_AFTCoop
text: function performs following steps: Prepares survival data (time, event indicator, log-transformed time) Estimates scale parameter (sigma) using survival::survreg Fits cooperative AFT models across specified rho values using aft_coop Generates predictions calculates C-index rho value training data Identifies selected features (non-zero coefficients) rho value

what: Train Block Random Forest for Survival Analysis â€” train_blockForest
title: Train Block Random Forest for Survival Analysis â€” train_blockForest
text: Trains block random forest model survival data using blockForest algorithm. Features organized blocks based specified prefixes (e.g., clinical, genomic, transcriptomic), allowing structured variable selection importance ranking.

title: Train Block Random Forest for Survival Analysis â€” train_blockForest
code: train_blockForest(   x_training,   y_training,   prefixes = NULL,   threads = 10,   always.split.variables = NULL,   n_top_genes = 100,   seed = 8240 )

title: Train Block Random Forest for Survival Analysis â€” train_blockForest
text: x_training matrix data frame training predictors. y_training data frame containing survival outcomes columns: overall_survival: Numeric survival time status: Numeric event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored) prefixes Character vector prefixes used define feature blocks. prefix identifies group related variables (e.g., c("clinical_", "omic1_", "omic2_")). parameter required must NULL. threads Integer specifying number parallel threads use. Default 10. always.split.variables Optional list variable names considered every split. Useful forcing important clinical variables evaluated. Must list; set NULL disable. Default NULL. n_top_genes Integer specifying number top important features select based variable importance. Default 100. seed Integer seed reproducibility. Default 8240.

title: Train Block Random Forest for Survival Analysis â€” train_blockForest
text: list containing: model trained blockForest model object. cindex Numeric training concordance index (C-index), calculated 1 - prediction error. pred Numeric vector linear predictors (prognostic scores) training samples, extracted cumulative hazard function. selected_features Character vector top N important features based impurity-based variable importance, N = n_top_genes. extra List containing additional information: variable_importance: Named numeric vector importance scores features blocks: List feature block indices defined prefixes

title: Train Block Random Forest for Survival Analysis â€” train_blockForest
text: function performs following steps: Organizes features blocks based specified prefixes Calculates block-specific mtry values using square root rule: sqrt(block_size) Trains survival random forest using logrank splitting rule Computes variable importance using impurity reduction Extracts training predictions performance metrics Selects top important features downstream analysis

what: Train Cooperative Learning Model for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” train_cooplearning
title: Train Cooperative Learning Model for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” train_cooplearning
text: Trains cooperative Lasso (CoopLasso) Cox regression model integrates multiple omics datasets survival prediction. method encourages cooperation different data modalities performing feature selection L1 regularization.

title: Train Cooperative Learning Model for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” train_cooplearning
code: train_cooplearning(   X_list,   y_training,   lambdaVector = seq(0.1, 0.9, 0.1),   folds = 5,   alpha = 1,   maxit = 100,   seed = 123 )

title: Train Cooperative Learning Model for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” train_cooplearning
text: X_list named list 2 3 omics data matrices data frames. element represents different omics layer (e.g., transcriptomics, proteomics, methylation). matrices must : Samples rows matching row names across omics layers Features columns y_training data frame containing survival outcomes : Row names matching sample identifiers X_list Column overall_survival: Numeric survival time Column status: Numeric event indicator (1 = event, 0 = censored) lambdaVector Numeric vector lambda values evaluate cross-validation. Default seq(0.1, 0.9, 0.1). Lambda controls strength regularization. folds Integer specifying number cross-validation folds lambda selection. Default 5. alpha Numeric value controlling agreement layers. alpha = 1 2 layers, alpha = 0.5 3 layers. Default 1. maxit Integer maximum number iterations optimization algorithm. Default 100. seed Integer seed reproducibility train/validation split cross-validation. Default 123.

title: Train Cooperative Learning Model for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” train_cooplearning
text: list containing: model trained cooplasso model object containing coefficient vector b model parameters. selected_lambda Numeric optimal lambda value selected cross-validation. selected_features Character vector feature names non-zero coefficients (selected features across omics layers). pred Numeric vector risk scores training samples. Higher values indicate higher risk (shorter predicted survival). cindex Numeric concordance index (C-index) training data, calculated reverse = TRUE account risk score directionality. omics Character vector omics layer names input X_list.

title: Train Cooperative Learning Model for Multi-Omics Survival Analysis â€” train_cooplearning
text: function performs following workflow: Validates input structure (2 3 omics layers required) Aligns samples across omics layers survival data using common identifiers Splits data training (90\ Performs k-fold cross-validation select optimal lambda parameter Trains final cooperative Lasso model selected lambda Computes risk scores C-index training data Identifies selected features non-zero coefficients

what: Train a Cox Elastic Net Model with Alpha Optimization â€” train_cox_glmnet_ElasticNet
title: Train a Cox Elastic Net Model with Alpha Optimization â€” train_cox_glmnet_ElasticNet
text: Fits Cox proportional hazards model using Elastic Net regularization. function iterates range alpha values identify optimal mixture L1 L2 penalties based cross-validated performance.

title: Train a Cox Elastic Net Model with Alpha Optimization â€” train_cox_glmnet_ElasticNet
code: train_cox_glmnet_ElasticNet(   x_training,   y_training,   nfolds = 5,   optimal_lambda = "minimum",   type_measure = "C",   alpha_range = seq(0.1, 0.9, by = 0.1),   penalty = NULL,   system_type = "unix",   nlambda = 200,   seed = 123 )

title: Train a Cox Elastic Net Model with Alpha Optimization â€” train_cox_glmnet_ElasticNet
text: x_training matrix data frame predictor variables. y_training data frame containing survival outcomes columns overall_survival status. nfolds Integer. Number folds cross-validation. Default 5. optimal_lambda Character. Rule lambda selection: "minimum" (lambda.min) "1se" (lambda.1se). type_measure Character. Performance metric CV (e.g., "C" C-index "deviance"). alpha_range Numeric vector. sequence alpha values (0 1) test. Default 0.1 0.9. penalty Optional numeric vector penalty factors individual features. system_type Character. Operating system: "unix" "windows". nlambda Integer. Number \(\lambda\) values glmnet path. Default 200. seed Integer. Seed reproducibility.

title: Train a Cox Elastic Net Model with Alpha Optimization â€” train_cox_glmnet_ElasticNet
text: named list containing: cv_fit: cv.glmnet object best performing alpha. best_alpha: alpha value yielded best CV result. selected_lambda: numeric \(\lambda\) used final model. selected_features: Predictors non-zero coefficients chosen alpha/lambda. pred: Linear predictors training set. cindex: Training set Concordance Index.

what: Train a Cox LASSO Model with Cross-Validation â€” train_cox_glmnet_LASSO
title: Train a Cox LASSO Model with Cross-Validation â€” train_cox_glmnet_LASSO
text: Fits Cox proportional hazards model using LASSO regularization (L1 penalty) k-fold cross-validation parallel processing support.

title: Train a Cox LASSO Model with Cross-Validation â€” train_cox_glmnet_LASSO
code: train_cox_glmnet_LASSO(   x_training,   y_training,   nfolds = 5,   optimal_lambda = "minimum",   type_measure = "C",   penalty = NULL,   system_type = "unix",   nlambda = 200,   seed = 123 )

title: Train a Cox LASSO Model with Cross-Validation â€” train_cox_glmnet_LASSO
text: x_training matrix data frame predictors (e.g., omics data). y_training data frame containing survival outcomes, specifically overall_survival (time) status (event). nfolds Integer. Number folds cross-validation. Default 5. optimal_lambda Character. Choice lambda prediction: "minimum" (lambda.min) "1se" (lambda.1se). type_measure Character. Loss function cross-validation. Default "C" (C-index). penalty Optional numeric vector penalty factors (e.g., Adaptive LASSO). system_type Character. Operating system type, either "unix" "windows", handle parallel backend registration. nlambda Integer. number \(\lambda\) values sequence. Default 200. seed Integer. Seed reproducibility cross-validation folds.

title: Train a Cox LASSO Model with Cross-Validation â€” train_cox_glmnet_LASSO
text: named list containing: optimal_lambda: selection rule used. cv_fit: fitted cv.glmnet object. selected_lambda: numeric value chosen \(\lambda\). selected_features: Character vector predictors non-zero coefficients. pred: Linear predictors training set. cindex: Training set Concordance Index.

what: Train an Adaptive Cox LASSO Model â€” train_cox_glmnet_adaptiveLASSO
title: Train an Adaptive Cox LASSO Model â€” train_cox_glmnet_adaptiveLASSO
text: Fits Cox proportional hazards model using Adaptive LASSO. two-step procedure uses Ridge regression coefficients create penalty factors, encouraging model select variables stronger initial signals.

title: Train an Adaptive Cox LASSO Model â€” train_cox_glmnet_adaptiveLASSO
code: train_cox_glmnet_adaptiveLASSO(   x_training,   y_training,   nfolds = 5,   optimal_lambda = "minimum",   type_measure = "C",   unpenalized = NULL,   system_type = "unix",   nlambda = 150,   seed = NULL )

title: Train an Adaptive Cox LASSO Model â€” train_cox_glmnet_adaptiveLASSO
text: x_training matrix data frame predictor variables. y_training data frame containing survival outcomes, specifically overall_survival (time) status (event). nfolds Integer. Number folds cross-validation steps. optimal_lambda Character. Choice lambda prediction: "minimum" "1se". type_measure Character. Loss function cross-validation (e.g., "C"). unpenalized Optional vector indices names variables excluded penalty (penalty set 0). system_type Character. OS type: "unix" "windows". nlambda Integer. Number \(\lambda\) values Ridge step sequence. seed Optional integer reproducibility.

title: Train an Adaptive Cox LASSO Model â€” train_cox_glmnet_adaptiveLASSO
text: named list containing: ridge_cv: preliminary Ridge cross-validation object. cv_fit: final Adaptive LASSO cross-validation object. selected_lambda: numeric \(\lambda\) used final model. selected_features: Predictors non-zero coefficients. pred: Linear predictors training set. cindex: Training set Concordance Index. weights: penalty factors derived Ridge step.

what: Train a Penalized Accelerated Failure Time (AFT) Model â€” train_penAFT
title: Train a Penalized Accelerated Failure Time (AFT) Model â€” train_penAFT
text: Fits penalized AFT model using penAFT package. function optimizes alpha parameter cross-validation balance regularization types, supporting standard Elastic Net Sparse Group LASSO.

title: Train a Penalized Accelerated Failure Time (AFT) Model â€” train_penAFT
code: train_penAFT(   x_training,   y_training,   nfolds = 5,   penalty = "EN",   alpha_range = seq(0.1, 0.9, by = 0.1),   groups = NULL,   nlambda = 100,   seed = 123 )

title: Train a Penalized Accelerated Failure Time (AFT) Model â€” train_penAFT
text: x_training matrix data frame predictors (samples rows). y_training data frame containing survival data overall_survival status columns. nfolds Integer. Number folds cross-validation. Default 5. penalty Character. penalty type apply: "EN" (Elastic Net) "SG" (Sparse Group LASSO). alpha_range Numeric vector. range alpha values test (mixture L1 L2, Group individual LASSO). groups vector integers indicating group membership predictors. Required penalty = "SG". nlambda Integer. Number \(\lambda\) values tuning grid. seed Integer NULL. Seed reproducibility.

title: Train a Penalized Accelerated Failure Time (AFT) Model â€” train_penAFT
text: named list containing: best_cv_fit: penAFT.cv object optimal alpha. best_alpha: selected alpha value. selected_lambda: value \(\lambda\) minimized CV error. selected_features: Names features non-zero coefficients. coefficients: Vector estimated coefficients. pred: Linear predictors training set. cindex: Training set Concordance Index. cv_results: list results tested alpha values.
